ai.engine.kepoj.layers

Class DynamicLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.engine.kepoj.layers.DynamicLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Layer, Serializable

    public class DynamicLayer
extends Object
implements Layer
    Layer implementation that uses a dynamic list to store the neurons and automatically affects the dependent layer.
    Since:
    1.2
    See Also:
    Layer, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicLayer

        public DynamicLayer(int initialSize,
                    ActivationFunction functions,
                    Layer nextLayer)
        Creates a layer with resizable neurons list
        Parameters:
        initialSize - number of neurons after initialization
        functions - activation function complex for this layer
        nextLayer - dependent layer whose weight lengths will change according to changes in the dynamic layer
        Since:
        1.2

      • DynamicLayer

        public DynamicLayer(int initialSize,
                    StandardFunctions function,
                    Layer nextLayer)
        Creates a layer with resizable neurons list
        Parameters:
        initialSize - number of neurons after initialization
        function - defined function from the StandardFunction enum
        nextLayer - dependent layer whose weight lengths will change according to changes in the dynamic layer
        Since:
        1.2

      • add

        public int add(Neuron neuron,
               double[] weights)
        Adds neuron to layer and sets specific weights between the neuron and the next layer
        Parameters:
        neuron - neuron to add
        weights - weights for this neuron on the next layer
        Returns:
        added neuron index
        Since:
        1.2

      • buildLayer

        public void buildLayer(Layer previous)
        Takes a length of the previous layer and uses it as a length of neurons weight. Usually, Layer must be built in the neural network class.
        Specified by:
        buildLayer in interface Layer
        Parameters:
        previous - layer object before current layer
        Since:
        1.1
